channel.title: What...? | Mac
channel.description:
So I am new to coding with Mac. I use Tiger 10.4.11 Please help me understand this? I try running my 317 Allstar server
http://imgur.com/RekUDEX[/img] http://imgur.com/T781gdA http://imgur.com/YHXmR8W
[img]http://imgur.com/RekUDEX[/img]
[img]http://imgur.com/T781gdA[/img]
[img]http://imgur.com/YHXmR8W[/img]

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“FizzerX637, post:16, topic:539375”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=658209.msg4403008#msg4403008 date=1391115369]
Sublime Text is pretty awesome and I use it for almost everything. It does syntax colouring, automatic indentation, etc etc. It also lets you organise collections of files into projects! Not sure if it’ll work on 10.4 though… Sublime 3 certainly wont work, but you could try Sublime 2 or maybe try getting an older version if that doesn’t work.

Failing that… Eclipse, Netbeans and IntelliJ are all great Java IDEs if you’re that way inclined.
[/quote]

I downloaded Eclipse, but I have no idea what it does, how it works, or anything. I have always used JDK on win 7.[/quote]Eclipse and JDK aren’t the same thing. JDK is the development kit, ie contains the Java compiler and related utilities. Eclipse is an IDE which allows programmers to program more efficiently (by managing files, code completion tc.) and handles most of the JDK interaction. To use an IDE you will need both.

All you need to do is create a new project, drag in your source code (any file ending in .java), move your config files into its project root then press debug. I wouldn’t recommend actually running your server like this though. Execute the output binary.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

xx matty xx:

Mac is great when you get used to it, especially for programming because you get all the unixy stuff. I guess that ancient version of Mac isn’t helping though… most of the old Mac OS’s were scarily bad.

Is there any program I could use to be an organized coder? I used NotePad++ with pc, and with Mac I currently use TextEdit. I need something I can be a cleaner coder that I can download using 10.4.11 (keep in mind, I am a Mac noob, and don’t know many programs I can download.)

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

xx matty xx:

Yeah you gotta find out the name of the file containing the main method because I have no idea. It’ll be called Main/RunServer/Server/Run/AllstarScape… I dunno lol

I’ll try to figure it out, but would this help ? lol

@echo off color 0a title Allstar-Scape java -Xmx512m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar: server

EDIT: MEGA FACEPALM It was java -Xmx512m server

… RIGHT IN FRONT OF MY FACE LOL. I fail with Mac if you can’t tell.

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:539375”]No problem

Just pass the name of the Java class to the java command, without the .class bit. Like this:

If the main class is Run.class. I don’t know what the actual class is… but it’ll be the one containing a main() method.[/quote]

[code]Last login: Thu Jan 30 14:13:38 on ttyp1
Welcome to Darwin!
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~ User$ cd /Users/User/Desktop/Allstar-Scape\ v2/
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Allstar-Scape v2 User$ java -Xmx412m Run
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Run
Exception in thread “main” Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/Allstar-Scape v2 User$

[/code]

Mac rapes my brain on a daily basis. :\

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

No problem

Just pass the name of the Java class to the java command, without the .class bit. Like this:

If the main class is Run.class. I don’t know what the actual class is… but it’ll be the one containing a main() method.

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:5, topic:539375”]“javac *.java will compile all Java files in that directory”

you have no files in that directory. either run the command inside the directory, or lookup the flags you need to pass to do it without changing directory. it’s exactly the same process as windows/linux.[/quote]

Thank you

Could you please try to help me run my 317 Allstar?

I get this when I try to run it

[code]Last login: Wed Jan 29 20:12:10 on console
Welcome to Darwin!
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~ User$ cd /Users/User/Desktop/RSPS/
Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/RSPS User$ java -Xmx412m
Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)

where options include:
-client to select the “client” VM
-server to select the “server” VM
-jvm is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
-hotspot is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
The default VM is client.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A : separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
                see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument

Codys-Macbook-Pro:~/Desktop/RSPS User$ [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

“javac *.java will compile all Java files in that directory”

you have no files in that directory. either run the command inside the directory, or lookup the flags you need to pass to do it without changing directory. it’s exactly the same process as windows/linux.

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @FizzerX637 FizzerX637
item.description:
@FizzerX637 wrote:

RUNE-PK:

What are you trying to do? lol

I am trying to run and compile my 317 allstar server. I am a complete noob when it comes to Mac. I am trying to learn about it, lol.

I know javac *.java compiles it, and I guess “java -Xmx412m” is suppose to run the server, but it doesnt…

Read full topic

item.title: What...? | Mac
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

javac *.java will compile all Java files in that directory. It wont search subdirectories without either cd’ing to that directory or changing the arguments passed to javac. As for the final command… you’re not telling java to run anything so nothing is going to happen.

Read full topic
